ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my Portuguese a lot, especially my writing and listening skills. Although my speaking skills also improved significantly, the latter are also the hardest ones when learning a new language.
I learned a lot about both the language and Brazilian culture!
Observed big improvement in my Portuguese writing skills.
I improved my Portuguese speaking and writing skills and learned more about Brazilian culture.
I improved my speaking, listening, reading, and writing skills in Portuguese and became familiar with words to describe places and experiences.
Portuguese conversational abilities, writing in Portuguese, how to present myself in Portuguese
I learned more grammar especially concerning verb tenses, how to pronounce certain sounds, more vocabulary, and how to form sentences that were more complex.
This course helped me improve my speaking and writing skills from last semester and enable me to be able to hold a conversation in Portuguese using tenses other than the present.
I learned A LOT about Brazilian culture and language!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the course is very strong and the approach is really good. It has a great balance between learning through the use of the language and the work with grammar and vocabulary.

The course is super relaxed and the assignments are genuinely so fun. All of my friends are jealous of our fun assignments and wish they took Portuguese! The strengths are the amazing professors, incredible course material, and relaxed vibe of the class. I looked forward to it every day and made me excited to keep learning the language. There truly are no weaknesses.

For the most part, I thought the course was well organized. However, the near-constant emphasis on group work sometimes came at the expense of immersion in the language, since students would generally speak with one another in English. I appreciated the opportunity to interact with Lusophone cultural materials, though I sometimes wished for more rigorous/formal discussions of the vocabulary and grammatical structures used in these materials.

The strength of the course is the practical applications of language skills to real world situations and emphasis on cultural understanding. In the future I could use more work on grammar, but I understand this was not the focus of the course.
Loved the projects and overall emphasis on collaboration, lots of assistance in pronunciation
Strengths: It is engaging with all the videos and activities; asynchronous days allowed us to approach material more independently; the learning games we played were really fun
I think it was taught very well, I enjoyed the small class size environment and working in groups.
I REALLY LOVED THIS COURSE! The class size was very manageable and we got tons of practice with the language!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I strongly recommend taking this class to other students. The class is great overall. It is incredible how much one learns in such a small amount of time and the environment is friendly and diverse, it always felt like a safe space.
To any student considering taking Portuguese  DO IT!! The best choice Ive made at Yale. The most amazing curriculum, supportive teachers, and incredible community!
I'd recommend this course to any student (genuinely) interested in learning Portuguese.
Great easy language
Yes! A great and accessible language course for anyone.
Yes, best language department at Yale

I would recommend the course to another student because I really liked the way the class incorporates different videos and activities to help with the learning process. There were multiple ways to learn a topic which I appreciated.
Yes!

I would definitely recommend this course. It is a low workload and low stress environment in which you can learn a language over the course of a semester and I definitely recommend for those having taken L1!
YES- great way to learn about Brazilian culture and language!
